title: Stomacher, late 17th or early 18th century
medium:
Medium: Linen, silk, metal foil-wrapped silk
Technique: Plain weave linen foundation, embroidered on the front with couching stitches. Trimmed with applied silk ribbon and woven metal trim. Backed with a block-printed linen lining printed with a pigment,
inscribed: Inscribed in dark brown ink on upper left edge on the front, "Queen Mary".
dimensions:
Height: 37.5cm (14 3/4 in.). Width at top: 26 cm (10 1/4in.).
Pattern: Straight repeat on block printed linen. Repeat H x W: 20 cm (8 in.) x 16.5 cm (6 1/2 in.).
description: The stomacher front is fabricated of heavily embroidered linen plain weave, lined with a block-printed linen fabric, and stiffened with ribs of an unidentified material. The upper edge is slightly u-shaped, and the point finishes in an arrow-head with three independent tabs on either side.  The embroidery is executed in silver-colored metal foil wrapped around a white silk core, couched to the linen. While the metal threads are laid on horizontally, the couching stitches follow a "V" pattern. Decoration in the form of a rose tied with a bow was made separately from red and green silk and gold foil wrapped silk in a needle-lace technique; it is sewn on top of the silver couching. The embroidered center panel is trimmed with white silk piping and a narrow woven metal ribbon. The block printed linen lining has a pattern of small birds in a scrolling vine in red on white.
